Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Guided vs Freehand Ventricular Catheter Placement

Trial_Design.evidence: multicenter, randomised controlled trial enrolled 139 eligible hydrocephalic patients

Intervention.evidence: randomised 1:1 to either guided or freehand catheter placement

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the accuracy of a guided ventricular catheter placement using a mobile health application.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of primary cannulation of grade I catheter position in the ipsilateral ventricle, assessed postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using an online password-protected database with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: enrolled 139 eligible hydrocephalic patients across 9 centers from April 2013 to December 2014

Number_Analysed.evidence: In the intention-to-treat analysis, 70 patients were in the guided group and 69 in the freehand group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was achieved in 70% of the guided group versus 56.5% in the freehand group (odds ratio 1.79, 95% CI 0.89-3.61).

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were observed in early catheter failure or complications.
